definition: flattering and fawning (idiom)/sweet-talking
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
flatter
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
to flatter
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive

sentences.english: Jack bootlicked to get a promotion;
sentences.chinese: 傑克阿諛奉承以得到晉升。

sentences.english: A wise man is superior to flattery.
sentences.chinese: 一個智者是不會被阿諛奉承所迷惑的。

sentences.english: I cannot be your friend and your flatterer too.
sentences.chinese: 我不能既是你的朋友，而又對你阿諛奉承。

sentences.english: A great man is above flattery.
sentences.chinese: 一個偉大的人是不屑於阿諛奉承的。

sentences.english: Flattery brings friends, but the truth begets enmity.
sentences.chinese: 阿諛奉承也許能交到朋友，但真相會引起憎恨。

sentences.english: I could not be ywe friend or ywe eventerer too.
sentences.chinese: 朋友無所不能阿諛奉承。
她以阿諛奉承博得寵幸。

sentences.english: Sycophancy was the device of the least trustworthy.
sentences.chinese: 阿諛奉承之輩最不可靠。

sentences.english: However, the Sagittarius woman is not the one who believes in flattery.
sentences.chinese: 但是，射手座的女人卻不相信阿諛奉承這一套。

sentences.english: He despised people who were lavish with their praises .
sentences.chinese: 他看不起那些阿諛奉承的人。

sentences.english: The implication is to curry favour, benefits from fish.
sentences.chinese: 阿諛奉承，其言外之意就是要從中撈取好處。

sentences.english: Forum-Ergebnisse für "I cannot be your friend and your flatterer too."
sentences.chinese: 我不能同時是你的朋友又是你的阿諛奉承者。

sentences.english: Nationalists believe the Philippines is cringing before its former masters.
sentences.chinese: 民族主義者認爲菲政府阿諛奉承過去的主人美國。

sentences.english: Don`t be sycophantic, no matter how much you love his money.
sentences.chinese: 無論你多麼愛慕他的錢財，也不要阿諛奉承。

sentences.english: He's always sucking up to the boss.
sentences.chinese: 他總是對老闆阿諛奉承。

definition: to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
shameful secret
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
idle gossip
to be strict with oneself
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
selfless/impartial
magnanimous
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to weigh up sb's words and observe their facial expression (idiom)/to discern what sb thinks from his body language
hoodlum/bad guy
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
